repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: The `:EditQuery` command accepts a language argument, but it
doesn't highlight properly for injected languages.

Solution: Fully parse with the root language and then filter the query on the
child trees that are of the language requested.

Closes #29943

comment_data.body:
instead of mentioning this in a different place, add a line after line 1324 like

    `:EditQuery <tab>` completes injected language names.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1328,6 +1328,9 @@ edit({lang})                                     *vim.treesitter.query.edit()*
     buffer, use `:write` to save it. You can find example queries at
     `$VIMRUNTIME/queries/`.
 
+    You may supply a language argument to `:EditQuery` for injected languages

comment_data.body: Let's put this logic in `vim.treesitter.query._complete()`. Need to keep defaults.lua as simple as possible.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -23,7 +23,19 @@ do
 
   vim.api.nvim_create_user_command('EditQuery', function(cmd)
     vim.treesitter.query.edit(cmd.fargs[1])
-  end, { desc = 'Edit treesitter query', nargs = '?' })
+  end, {
+    desc = 'Edit treesitter query',
+    nargs = '?',
+    complete = function()

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
  -- <one-line comment that gives a hint about what this does>
  parser:for_each_tree(function(tree, ltree)
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -581,21 +582,28 @@ local function update_editor_highlights(query_win, base_win, lang)
   end
   -- Remove the '@' from the cursor word
   cursor_word = cursor_word:sub(2)
-  local topline, botline = vim.fn.line('w0', base_win), vim.fn.line('w$', base_win)
-  for id, node in query:iter_captures(parser:trees()[1]:root(), base_buf, topline - 1, botline) do
-    local capture_name = query.captures[id]
-    if capture_name == cursor_word then
-      local lnum, col, end_lnum, end_col = node:range()
-      api.nvim_buf_set_extmark(base_buf, edit_ns, lnum, col, {
-        end_row = end_lnum,
-        end_col = end_col,
-        hl_group = 'Visual',
-        virt_text = {
-          { capture_name, 'Title' },
-        },
-      })
+  parser:parse(true)
+  parser:for_each_tree(function(tree, ltree)

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
--- Can also be shown with `:EditQuery`. [:EditQuery]()
--- `:EditQuery <tab>` completes injected language names.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1161,10 +1161,23 @@ function M.omnifunc(findstart, base)
   return vim.treesitter._query_linter.omnifunc(findstart, base)
 end
 
+--- Returns available treesitter languages.
+function M._complete()
+  local parsers = vim.api.nvim_get_runtime_file('parser/*', true)
+  local parser_names_set = {} ---@type table<string, boolean>
+  for _, parser in ipairs(parsers) do
+    local parser_name = vim.fn.fnamemodify(parser, ':t:r')
+    parser_names_set[parser_name] = true
+  end
+  return vim.tbl_keys(parser_names_set)
+end
+
 --- Opens a live editor to query the buffer you started from.
 ---
 --- Can also be shown with `:EditQuery`. [:EditQuery]()
 ---
+--- `:EditQuery <tab>` completes injected language names.

comment_data.body: oh probably `/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/language.lua` is a more appropriate place for this
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1161,10 +1161,23 @@ function M.omnifunc(findstart, base)
   return vim.treesitter._query_linter.omnifunc(findstart, base)
 end
 
+--- Returns available treesitter languages.
+function M._complete()

comment_data.body:
try this

```
--- Can also be shown with `:EditQuery`. `:EditQuery <tab>` completes injected language names. [:EditQuery]()
```

btw, I'm confused about the mention of "injected languages" in your docs, since it looks like `_complete()` just iterates all available parsers, not specific to "injected languages" for the current buffer.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1161,10 +1161,23 @@ function M.omnifunc(findstart, base)
   return vim.treesitter._query_linter.omnifunc(findstart, base)
 end
 
+--- Returns available treesitter languages.
+function M._complete()
+  local parsers = vim.api.nvim_get_runtime_file('parser/*', true)
+  local parser_names_set = {} ---@type table<string, boolean>
+  for _, parser in ipairs(parsers) do
+    local parser_name = vim.fn.fnamemodify(parser, ':t:r')
+    parser_names_set[parser_name] = true
+  end
+  return vim.tbl_keys(parser_names_set)
+end
+
 --- Opens a live editor to query the buffer you started from.
 ---
 --- Can also be shown with `:EditQuery`. [:EditQuery]()

comment_data.body:
perf nit: vim.ts is [lazy loaded](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/7cd5356a6f89a46d83bbba9b7f6496b67f054629/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter.lua#L6) so let's wrap this to avoid eager-loading it:
```suggestion
    complete = function(...) return vim.treesitter.language._complete(...) end,
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -23,7 +23,11 @@ do
 
   vim.api.nvim_create_user_command('EditQuery', function(cmd)
     vim.treesitter.query.edit(cmd.fargs[1])
-  end, { desc = 'Edit treesitter query', nargs = '?' })
+  end, {
+    desc = 'Edit treesitter query',
+    nargs = '?',
+    complete = vim.treesitter.language._complete,

lint doesn't like this

```suggestion
    complete = function() return vim.treesitter.language._complete() end,
```

labels.description: Nvim defaults for options, colorscheme/theme, autocmds/events, etc.
labels.name: defaults

title: feat(treesitter): support language argument in `:EditQuery`
